page.title: 08Adisham Policing and Crime
page.content: There is a policeman who lives in Adisham village police house on the council estate. His duties, however, include the general cover of the whole rural district of Canterbury, done by car with others. This means that only a very small proportion of time is spent policing the village and makes it difficult for him to socialize. His home is open to callers who come for a variety of reasons. Fortunately there does not seem to be much crime in the area. Burglary, car thefts and damage, petrol syphoning from cars and youthful misdemeanours are the main problem. The villagers appeared to be satisfied with the policing. Some fears were ex- pressed regarding the future increase in the teenage population and the possible consequences on the peace of the community. Special constables living there do not normally police it.
